# Description of DataSchema variable

The description of harmonised variable is the following:

* Short name: `cvd_all`
* Variable label: `History of all Cardiovascular diseases`
* Variable description: `The participant has been diagnosed by one or more of the following conditions: angina, stroke, myocardial infarction, heart attack, coronary heart disease, congestive heart failure, heart murmur, valve disease, cerebral vascular disease`
* Domain: `Diseases`
* Value type: `categorical`
* Category coding:

**Code** | **Category Label**
-------- | ------------------
0        | No, the participant has not been diagnosed of any of these conditions
1        | Yes, the participant has been diagnosed by any of these conditions

* Category missings: 

**Code** | **Category Label**
----| ------------------
991 | CAPI/interviewer error
992 | Impute
993 | Disable to measure
994 | Not attempt/not done
995 | Does not answer
996 | Not applicable
997 | Refuse
998 | Do not know
999 | Missing



<!-- ########################################################## --> 
<!-- # Global variables -->
```{r global, include=FALSE, echo=F}
miss_values_vector <- c(991, 992, 993, 994, 995, 996, 997, 998, 999)
ds_label <- "History of all Cardiovascular diseases"
cat_label <- c("No" = 0, "Yes" = 1, "Missing" = 999, "Do not know" = 998, "Refuse" = 997, "Not applicable" = 996, "Does not answer" = 995, "Not attempt not done" = 994, "Disable to measure" = 993, "Impute" = 992, "CAPI interviewer error" = 991)
datafolder <- "../RData/"
#sing_idlist <- c()
```

# Data process



## HRS

### Wave 1

#### Study-specific variable description

| **Name** | `R1HEARTE` |`R1STROKE`|
|-|-|-|
| **Label** | `R1HEARTE:W1 R ever had heart problems`|`R1STROKE:W1 R ever had stroke`|
| **Table name**  | `HRS-HRS-w1`|`HRS-HRS-w1`|
| **Categories** | `0 = no`<br/>`1 = yes` |`0 = no`<br/>`1 = yes` |
| **Missings** | `NA` |`NA` |
| **Description** |  |

```{r assign hrs_w1, echo=F}

opal.assign.table.tibble(o, 'HRS_hrs_w1','HRS.HRS-HRS-w1',variables=list('R1HEARTE','R1STROKE'), missings = T)
HRS_hrs_w1 <- opal.execute(o,'HRS_hrs_w1')

```

```{r local hrs_w1, echo=F}

vbl <- HRS_hrs_w1$R1HEARTE
kable(Categorical_summary(vbl, missing_values = NA)[2], caption = names(HRS_hrs_w1)[2])
kable(Categorical_summary(vbl, missing_values = NA)[1], caption = "Category")
ggplot(HRS_hrs_w1, aes(x=factor(R1HEARTE))) + geom_bar(stat="count", width=0.4, fill="steelblue") + xlab(label(vbl)) + ylab("Frequency")

vbl <- HRS_hrs_w1$R1STROKE
kable(Categorical_summary(vbl, missing_values = NA)[2], caption = names(HRS_hrs_w1)[3])
kable(Categorical_summary(vbl, missing_values = NA)[1], caption = "Category")
ggplot(HRS_hrs_w1, aes(x=factor(R1STROKE))) + geom_bar(stat="count", width=0.4, fill="steelblue") + xlab(label(vbl)) + ylab("Frequency")

```


#### Harmonisation algorithm

To compute `cvd_all` from the study-specific variable it has to be recoded as follows:

* `some 1 into 1`
* `all 0 into 0`
* `NA into 999`


**R script:**

```{r harmo hrs_w1}

# Categorical variable harmonization
HRS_ds_hrs_w1 <- tibble(id=HRS_hrs_w1$id)
HRS_ds_hrs_w1$cvd_all <- rep(999,length(HRS_hrs_w1$id))
HRS_ds_hrs_w1$cvd_all[which(HRS_hrs_w1$R1HEARTE==1 | HRS_hrs_w1$R1STROKE==1)] <- 1
HRS_ds_hrs_w1$cvd_all[which(HRS_hrs_w1$R1HEARTE==0 & HRS_hrs_w1$R1STROKE==0)] <- 0

```


#### Statistics of the new harmonized variable

```{r descript hrs_w1, echo=F}

vbl <- HRS_ds_hrs_w1$cvd_all
kable(Categorical_summary(vbl, missing_values = miss_values_vector)[3], caption = ds_label)
kable(Categorical_summary(vbl, missing_values = miss_values_vector)[1], caption = "Category")
kable(Categorical_summary(vbl, missing_values = miss_values_vector)[2], caption = "Type of missing")
ggplot(HRS_ds_hrs_w1, aes(x=factor(cvd_all))) + geom_bar(stat="count", width=0.4, fill="steelblue") + xlab(ds_label) + ylab("Frequency")

```


#### Validation

```{r crosstabulation hrs_w1, echo=F}

AfterH <- table(HRS_ds_hrs_w1$cvd_all, useNA = "ifany")
X <- c(sum(HRS_hrs_w1$R1HEARTE==0 & HRS_hrs_w1$R1STROKE==0,na.rm=T),sum(HRS_hrs_w1$R1HEARTE==1 | HRS_hrs_w1$R1STROKE==1,na.rm=T))
BeforeH <- c(X[1:2],length(HRS_hrs_w1$id)-sum(X,na.rm=T))
C <- rbind(BeforeH,AfterH)
colnames(C) <- c("all 0->0","some 1->1","NA->999")
kable(C)
rm(HRS_hrs_w1)

```

```{r harmo mbb_w11}
HRS_ds_mbb_w11$cvd_all <- rep(999,length(HRS_mbb_w11$id))
HRS_ds_mbb_w11$cvd_all[which(HRS_mbb_w11$R11HEARTE==1 | HRS_mbb_w11$R11STROKS==1)] <- 1
HRS_ds_mbb_w11$cvd_all[which(HRS_mbb_w11$R11HEARTE==0 & HRS_mbb_w11$R11STROKS==0)] <- 0






```


#### Statistics of the new harmonized variable

```{r descript mbb_w11, echo=F}

vbl <- HRS_ds_mbb_w11$cvd_all
kable(Categorical_summary(vbl, missing_values = miss_values_vector)[3], caption = ds_label)
kable(Categorical_summary(vbl, missing_values = miss_values_vector)[1], caption = "Category")
kable(Categorical_summary(vbl, missing_values = miss_values_vector)[2], caption = "Type of missing")
ggplot(HRS_ds_mbb_w11, aes(x=factor(cvd_all))) + geom_bar(stat="count", width=0.4, fill="steelblue") + xlab(ds_label) + ylab("Frequency")







```


#### Validation

```{r crosstabulation mbb_w11, echo=F, results='asis'}

AfterH <- table(HRS_ds_mbb_w11$cvd_all, useNA = "ifany")
X <- c(sum(HRS_mbb_w11$R11HEARTE==0 & HRS_mbb_w11$R11STROKS==0,na.rm=T),sum(HRS_mbb_w11$R11HEARTE==1 | HRS_mbb_w11$R11STROKS==1,na.rm=T))
BeforeH <- c(X[1:2],length(HRS_mbb_w11$id)-sum(X,na.rm=T))
C <- rbind(BeforeH,AfterH)
colnames(C) <- c("all 0->0","some 1->1","NA->999")
kable(C)

rm(HRS_mbb_w11)

```

Two tables are generated: 

1. Percentages of categories in each harmonised variable.

The harmonized variable contains information about heart attack, coronary heart disease, angina, congestive heart failure, or other heart problems and stroke.
